org.efaps.db.databases

Class AbstractDatabase<T extends AbstractDatabase<?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.efaps.db.databases.AbstractDatabase<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - derived DB class
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DerbyDatabase, MySQLDatabase, OracleDatabase, PostgreSQLDatabase

    public abstract class AbstractDatabase<T extends AbstractDatabase<?>>
extends Object
    Abstract definition of database specific information and methods like alter of table columns.
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    The eFaps Team

      The enumeration defines the known column types in the database.

      • isConnected

        public abstract boolean isConnected(Connection _connection)
                             throws SQLException
        Method is used to determine if this DataBase is connected. It uses SQL statements against the database to determine if it is the right database using unique identifiers e.g. systemtables, version info etc.
        Parameters:
        _connection - Connection to be used foo analyze
        Returns:
        true if this database is connected
        Throws:
        SQLException - on error

      • addMapping

        protected void addMapping(AbstractDatabase.ColumnType _columnType,
              String _writeTypeName,
              String _nullValueSelect,
              String... _readTypeNames)
        Adds a new mapping for given eFaps column type used for mapping from and to the SQL database.
        Parameters:
        _columnType - column type within eFaps
        _writeTypeName - SQL type name used to write (create new column within a SQL table)
        _nullValueSelect - null value select used within the query if a link target could be a null (and so all selected values must null in the SQL statement for objects without this link)
        _readTypeNames - list of SQL type names returned from the database meta data reading
        See Also:
        to map from an eFaps column type to a SQL type name, to map from a SQL type name to possible eFaps column types

      • getReadColumnTypes

        public Set<AbstractDatabase.ColumnType> getReadColumnTypes(String _readTypeName)
        Converts given SQL column type name in a set of eFaps column types. If no mapping is specified, a null is returned.
        Parameters:
        _readTypeName - SQL column type name read from the database
        Returns:
        set of eFaps column types (or null if not specified)
        See Also:
        readColTypeMap, used to define the map

      • deleteAll

        public abstract void deleteAll(Connection _con)
                        throws SQLException
        The method implements a delete all of database user specific objects (e.g. tables, views etc...). The method is called before a complete rebuild is done.
        Parameters:
        _con - sql connection
        Throws:
        SQLException - if delete of the SQL data model failed

      • getCachedTableInformation

        public TableInformation getCachedTableInformation(String _tableName)
                                           throws SQLException
        Returns for given table name all information about the table and returns them as instance of TableInformation. The information is cached and NOT evaluated directly.
        Parameters:
        _tableName - name of SQL table for which the information is fetched
        Returns:
        instance of TableInformation with table information
        Throws:
        SQLException - if information about the table could not be fetched
        See Also:
        TableInformation, getRealTableInformation(Connection, String), cache

                                       String _tableName)
                                         throws SQLException

        Parameters:
        _con - SQL connection
        _tableName - name of SQL table for which the information is fetched
        Returns:
        instance of TableInformation with table information

      • addUniqueKey

        public T addUniqueKey(Connection _con,
             String _tableName,
             String _uniqueKeyName,
             String _columns)
                                           throws SQLException
        Adds a new unique key to given table name.
        Parameters:
        _con - SQL connection

        _uniqueKeyName - name of unique key

        Throws:

      • addForeignKey

        public T addForeignKey(Connection _con,
              String _tableName,
              String _foreignKeyName,
              String _key,
              String _reference,
              boolean _cascade)
                                            throws InstallationException
        Adds a foreign key to given SQL table.
        Parameters:
        _con - SQL connection
        _tableName - name of table for which the foreign key must be created
        _foreignKeyName - name of foreign key to create
        _key - key in the table (column name)
        _reference - external reference (external table and column name)
        _cascade - if the value in the external table is deleted, should this value also automatically deleted?
        Returns:
        this instance
        Throws:
        InstallationException - if foreign key could not be defined for SQL table

        _checkKeyName - name of check key to create
        _condition - condition of the check key
        Throws:

      • getMaxExpressions

        public int getMaxExpressions()

        This integer is used for the maximum numbers of Values inside an expression.

        The value is used in the OneRounQuery. The SQL statement looks like "SELECT...WHERE..IN (val1,val2,val3,...valn)" The integer is the maximum value for n before making a new Select.

        Returns:
        max Number of Value in an Expression, -1 if no max is known

      • getNewId

        public long getNewId(Connection _con,
            String _table,
            String _column)
              throws SQLException
        A new id for given column of a SQL table is returned (e.g. with sequences). This abstract class always throws a SQLException, because for default, it is not needed to implement (only if the JDBC drive does not implement method 'getGeneratedKeys' for java.sql.Statements).
        Parameters:
        _con - sql connection
        _table - sql table for which a new id must returned
        _column - sql table column for which a new id must returned
        Returns:
        new id number
        Throws:
        SQLException - always, because method itself is not implemented not not allowed to call

      • supportsGetGeneratedKeys

        public boolean supportsGetGeneratedKeys()
        The method returns if a database implementation supports to get generated keys while inserting a new line in a SQL table.
        Returns:
        always false because not implemented in this class

      • supportsMultiGeneratedKeys

        public boolean supportsMultiGeneratedKeys()
        The method returns if a database implementation support to get multiple auto generated keys. If defined to true, the insert is done with defined column names for the auto generated columns. Otherwise only Statement.RETURN_GENERATED_KEYS is given for the insert.
        Returns:
        always false because not implemented in this class
        See Also:
        supportsGetGeneratedKeys()

      • supportsBlobInputStreamAvailable

        public boolean supportsBlobInputStreamAvailable()
        The method returns if a database implementation supports for blobs binary input stream supports the available method or not.
        Returns:
        always false because not implemented in this class
        See Also:
        supportsBinaryInputStream()

      • supportsBinaryInputStream

        public boolean supportsBinaryInputStream()
        The method returns if a database implementation supports directly binary stream for result sets (instead of using first blobs).
        Returns:
        always false because not implemented in this class
        See Also:
        supportsBlobInputStreamAvailable()

      • supportsBigTransactions

        public boolean supportsBigTransactions()
        Returns true if a database could handle big transactions used within the eFaps updates.
        Returns:
        always true because normally a database should implement big transactions

      • getConstrainName

        public String getConstrainName(String _name)
                        throws EFapsException
        Parameters:
        _name - name of the constraint as defined
        Returns:
        name as used by the database
        Throws:
        EFapsException - on error

      • getTableName

        public String getTableName(String _name)
                    throws EFapsException
        Parameters:
        _name - name of the table as defined
        Returns:
        name as used by the database
        Throws:
        EFapsException - on error

      • getHibernateDialect

        public abstract String getHibernateDialect()
        Get the Dialect to access the DataBase using Hibernate.
        Returns:
        the Dialect for Hibernate

      • findByClassName

        public static AbstractDatabase<?> findByClassName(String _dbClassName)
                                           throws ClassNotFoundException,
                                                  InstantiationException,
                                                  IllegalAccessException
        Instantiate the given DB class name and returns them.
        Parameters:
        _dbClassName - name of the class to instantiate
        Returns:
        new database definition instance
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - if class for the DB is not found
        InstantiationException - if DB class could not be instantiated
        IllegalAccessException - if DB class could not be accessed

      • initTableInfo

        protected void initTableInfo(Connection _con,
                 String _sql,
                 Map<String,TableInformation> _cache4Name)
                      throws SQLException

        Fetches all table name for all tables and views. If a SQL statement is given, this SQL statement is used instead of using the JDBC meta data methods. The SQL select statement must define this column

        • TABLE_NAME for the real name of the table.

        Parameters:
        _con - SQL connection
        _sql - SQL statement which must be executed if the JDBC functionality does not work (or null if JDBC meta data is used to fetch all tables and views)
        _cache4Name - map used to fetch depending on the table name the related table information
        Throws:
        SQLException - if information could not be fetched from the data base

      • initTableInfoColumns

        protected void initTableInfoColumns(Connection _con,
                        String _sql,
                        Map<String,TableInformation> _cache4Name)
                             throws SQLException

        Fetches all unique keys for all tables. If a SQL statement is given, this SQL statement is used instead of using the JDBC meta data methods. The SQL select statement must define this four columns

        • TABLE_NAME for the real name of the table,
        • COLUMN_NAME for the name of a column,
        • TYPE_NAME for the name of the column type,
        • COLUMN_SIZE for the size of the column,
        • DECIMAL_DIGITS for the count of decimal digits (if the TYPE_NAME is number) and
        • IS_NULLABLE if the column could have no value (with value "NO" if no null value is allowed).

        Parameters:
        _con - SQL connection
        _sql - SQL statement which must be executed if the JDBC functionality does not work (or null if JDBC meta data is used to fetch the table columns)
        _cache4Name - map used to cache depending on the table name the related table information
        Throws:
        SQLException - if column information could not be fetched

      • initTableInfoUniqueKeys

        protected void initTableInfoUniqueKeys(Connection _con,
                           String _sql,
                           Map<String,TableInformation> _cache4Name)
                                throws SQLException

        Fetches all unique keys for all tables. If a SQL statement is given, this SQL statement is used instead of using the JDBC meta data methods. The SQL select statement must define this four columns

        • TABLE_NAME for the real name of the table,
        • INDEX_NAME for the real name of the unique key name,
        • COLUMN_NAME for the name of a column within the unique key and
        • ORDINAL_POSITION for the position of the column name within the unique key.
        If more than one column is used to define the unique key, one line for each column name with same index name must be used.

        Parameters:
        _con - SQL connection
        _sql - SQL statement which must be executed if the JDBC functionality does not work (or null if JDBC meta data is used to fetch the unique keys)
        _cache4Name - map used to fetch depending on the table name the related table information
        Throws:
        SQLException - if unique keys could not be fetched

      • initTableInfoForeignKeys

        protected void initTableInfoForeignKeys(Connection _con,
                            String _sql,
                            Map<String,TableInformation> _cache4Name)
                                 throws SQLException

        Fetches all foreign keys for all tables. If a SQL statement is given, this SQL statement is used instead of using the JDBC meta data methods. The SQL select statement must define this six columns

        • TABLE_NAME for the real name of the table,
        • FK_NAME for the real name of the foreign key name,
        • FKCOLUMN_NAME for the name of the column for which the foreign key is defined,
        • PKTABLE_NAME for the name of the referenced table,
        • PKCOLUMN_NAME for the name of column within the referenced table and
        • DELETE_RULE defining the rule what happens in the case a row of the table is deleted (with value DatabaseMetaData.importedKeyCascade in the case the delete is cascaded).

        Parameters:
        _con - SQL connection
        _sql - SQL statement which must be executed if the JDBC functionality does not work (or null if JDBC meta data is used to fetch the foreign keys)
        _cache4Name - map used to fetch depending on the table name the related table information
        Throws:
        SQLException - if foreign keys could not be fetched

      • getRowProcessor

        public abstract org.apache.commons.dbutils.RowProcessor getRowProcessor()
        Get the RowProcessor responsible to read the data from a recordset into eFaps.
        Returns:
        a RowProcessor
